name: Modular Open Robots Simulation Engine
tagline: The open-source simulator for academic robotics
body:
<iframe src="http://player.vimeo.com/video/62855423?title=0&byline=0&portrait=0&color=ffffff" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowFullScreen></iframe>

### MORSE is a generic simulator for academic robotics

MORSE is an generic simulator for academic robotics. It focuses on realistic simulation of small to large environments, indoor or outdoor, with one to over a dozen of autonomous robots.

MORSE provides out of the box a large set of standard sensors (cameras, laser scanner, GPS, odometry,...), actuators (speed controllers, high-level waypoints controllers, generic joint controllers) as well as several robotic platforms (ATRV, generic 4 wheel vehicle, PR2,...). New ones can easily be added.

Besides generic socket-based APIs, MORSE fully integrates with standard robotic middlewares, including ROS and YARP.

[Learn more!](http://www.openrobots.org/morse/doc/latest/what_is_morse.html)

### Get the code

Fork us on GitHub: [github.com/morse-simulator/morse](http://github.com/morse-simulator/morse)

...or download the [lastest stable release](ftp://ftp.openrobots.org/pub/openrobots/morse/morse-1.0.1.tar.bz2) (`morse-1.0.1.tar.bz2` - 93MB - 02-Apr-2013).

#### Installation

Check the [installation notes](http://www.openrobots.org/morse/doc/stable/user/installation.html).

> MORSE is mainly supported on Linux and MacOSX. It has been reported to work as well on Windows.

### Latest news

| ------------- |:-------------:|
| 6-7 Jun 2013      | [First Intl MORSE Workshop](http://www.openrobots.org/wiki/morse/events/workshop_june_2013) |
| 2 Apr 2013      | [MORSE 1.0.1 release](https://github.com/laas/morse/blob/1.0/RELEASE_NOTES) (maintenance release)  |


### Get in touch!

MORSE is 100% developed and supported by the academic community, with over 10 labs involved worldwide.

If you have questions or run into issues, contact us on the [`morse-dev@laas.fr`](https://sympa.laas.fr/sympa/subscribe/morse-users) mailing-list.

You can also report bug (or feature wishes) on the [MORSE issue tracker](https://github.com/morse-simulator/morse/issues).
